input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The relation from which extract named entities
input_tables.description: The relation from which extract named entities

input_tables.name: rules
input_tables.rDescription: The relation that contains the regex rules
input_tables.description: The relation that contains the regex rules

input_tables.name: dict
input_tables.rDescription: The relation that contains the dictionary for named entities
input_tables.description: The relation that contains the dictionary for named entities

argument_clauses.name: TextColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the text to analyze.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the text to analyze.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Language
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the language of the input text: en (English, the default), zh_CN (Simplified Chinese), zh_TW (Traditional Chinese)
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the language of the input text: en (English, the default), zh_CN (Simplified Chinese), zh_TW (Traditional Chinese)

argument_clauses.name: Models
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the CRF models (binary files) to use, generated by “ta.nertrainer”. If you specified the ExtractorJAR argument in the ta.nertrainer call that generated model_file, then you must specify the same jar_file in this argument. You must install model_file and jar_file in Aster Database under the user search path before calling the ta.ner function. Note: The names model_file and jar_file are case-sensitive.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the CRF models (binary files) to use, generated by “NERTrainer”. If you specified the ExtractorJAR argument in the NERTrainer call that generated model_file, then you must specify the same jar_file in this argument. You must install model_file and jar_file in Aster Database under the user search path before calling the NER function. Note: The names model_file and jar_file are case-sensitive.

argument_clauses.name: ShowEntityContext
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of context words to output. If context_words is n (which must be a positive integer), the function outputs the n words that precede the entity, the entity, and the n words that follow the entity. The default value is 0.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of context words to output. If context_words is n (which must be a positive integer), the function outputs the n words that precede the entity, the entity, and the n words that follow the entity. The default value is 0.
